ace_zero.agents.goal_agent.pilot module¶

Pilot Module

Although this works, currently is incomplete:

TODO: - Need to implement plans for all the commands we can issue - Need to add some higher level plans - Need to populate the PilotBeliefs class - Need to update the current plans so that the goals aren’t achieved as soon

a command/action is issued.

class ace_zero.agents.goal_agent.pilot.PilotAgent(params_filename)[source]¶

Bases: agents.agent.Agent

A class representing the pilot agent decision making. Each pilot has a name, a set of beliefs, a current goal, a list of current actions to send to the environment and a current missions (which is a queue of commands/actions)

add_action(action)[source]¶

Append action to the action list.

add_mission(mission)[source]¶

Add a new mission.

cobra_mission()[source]¶

Creates a mission profile for cobra pilot. The mission profile is a list of commands that the pilot should execute. It includes time delays between commands. Note that here we’ve hard code the mission into the code. The long term plan is to pull this out somehow into a data file (most likely a .json representation).

get_actions()[source]¶

Returns the current set of actions.

get_commands()[source]¶

Returns the current set of actions. Commands is a pseudonym for actions.

set_beliefs(beliefs)[source]¶
tick(t, dt)[source]¶

Ticks the agent every time step. Clears the previous set of actions. If we don’t have a goal or we have achieved the current goal and we still have stuff to do in our mission, get a new goal. Otherwise just tick the current goal.

update_beliefs(my_state, adversary_state)[source]¶

Updates the pilot’s beliefs about it’s own and adversary state

viper_mission()[source]¶

Creates a mission profile for viper pilot. The mission profile is a list of commands that the pilot should execute. It includes time delays between commands. Note that here we’ve hard code the mission into the code. The long term plan is to pull this out somehow into a data file (most likely a .json representation).
